channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - World

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: The US president said he believed the draft decision “would mean that every other decision related to the notion of privacy is thrown into question”.
item.title: Biden says ‘radical’ Roe v Wade draft ruling threatens privacy in the US

item.dc:creator: Matthew Barakat
item.description: The new testimony contradicts that of a psychologist hired by Depp’s lawyers, who said Heard suffered from borderline personality disorder.
item.title: Johnny Depp sexually assaulted Amber Heard, says psychologist

item.description: Leaked document suggests US Supreme Court is on the verge of overturning historic Roe v Wade ruling.
item.title: US President Joe Biden says he's ready to protect abortion rights

item.description: Boris Johnson tells Ukraine Parliament their country will win war.
item.title: British PM echoes Winston Churchill in address to Ukrainian MPs

item.dc:creator: Shane Harris
item.description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has prompted more Russians to take the risky step of getting in touch with the intelligence agency, officials said.
item.title: ‘Don’t use your home computer’: CIA instructs Russians on how to share secrets

item.dc:creator: Cara Anna and Yesica Fisch
item.description: Russian soldiers have stormed the steel mill just as scores of civilians evacuated the bombed-out plant. They have also struck Lviv.
item.title: Russian forces storm Mariupol plant as civilians evacuate

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Joseph Day, a cameraman from New Zealand, went missing on Saturday.
item.title: Missing Kiwi cameraman found dead in the UK, police say

item.dc:creator: Mark Sherman and Zeke Miller
item.description: Roe v. Wade is the 1973 Supreme Court decision that legalised abortion nationwide in the United States.
item.title: Biden vows to enshrine Roe v Wade into law if court overturns case

item.dc:creator: Cara Anna, Inna Varenytsia and Margaryta Chornokondratenko
item.description: As Putin looks to exploit the anniversary of Stalin’s defeat of the Nazis, his foreign ministry has accused israel of supporting ’the neo-Nazi regime in Kyiv”.
item.title: Putin may declare war on May 9 and start conscription, US officials warn

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Make no mistake: today’s leaked Supreme Court draft decision has the potential to completely reshape the social and political landscape in America.
item.title: The repeal of the right to an abortion would be Trump’s real legacy

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: What was this famous US court decision – and what would happen if it were overturned?
item.title: What is Roe v Wade, and what happens if it is overturned?

item.dc:creator: Kirsty Needham
item.description: It’s not clear which Russian billionaire ultimately owns the luxury vessel, which sports a helipad, live lobster tank and a grand piano.
item.title: US can seize Russian oligarch’s $436m superyacht: Fiji court

item.description: Efforts restart after Russian shelling halted operation.
item.title: Evacuation of hundreds of Ukrainian civilians resume in Mariupol

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Amy Chang Chien and Amy Qin
item.description: China’s capital has reopened a 1000-bed hospital first used during the SARS epidemic in 2003.
item.title: Beijing reopens COVID isolation centre to avoid Shanghai-style lockdown

item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall and William Neff
item.description: “The Russians have known about this for 31 years - you have to say they’ve just chosen not to deal with it,” said one US military professor.
item.title: The ‘jack-in-the-box’ flaw that dooms some Russian tanks

item.description: The evacuation of Mariupol continues as Russian artillery continues to pummel Eastern Ukraine.
item.title: Gallery: Ukraine - Russia crisis, May 3rd, 2022

item.description: A US couple has been left shaken up after a black bear charged at them in an attack that was caught on camera.
item.title: Couple charged by bear in viral video

item.dc:creator: Mick Ryan
item.description: China has wrong-footed Australia with its Solomon Islands pact. Regardless of who wins the federal election, a rapid strategic assessment will be needed to adjust our national security priorities.
item.title: China’s deal with the Solomons is an act of colonisation

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: One passenger said he only learned his bags were offloaded at Darwin 15 minutes before landing at Heathrow.
item.title: Dreamliner nightmare as Qantas dumps economy luggage in Darwin for London flights
